body.head: At the Complimentary Dinner, Camden, New Jersey, May 31, 1889.
body.p: Walt Whitman said: My friends, though announced to give an address, there is no such intention.

Following the impulse of the spirit, (for I am at least half of Quaker stock) I have obeyed the command to come and look at you, my friends, for a minute, and show myself, face to face; which is probably the best I can do. But I have felt no command to make a speech; and shall not therefore attempt any. All I have felt the imperative conviction to say I have already printed in my books of poems or prose; to which I refer any who may be curious. And so, hail and farewell. Deeply acknowledging this deep compliment, with my best respects and love to you personally—to Camden—to New-Jersey, and to all represented here—you must excuse me from any word further.
